findings.title: Reward Tokens Are Not Pre-Positioned
findings.description: The reward tokens are not pre-positioned when setting up initReward in the MiningPool and SwapBonus contracts.

findings.title: Reward Limit Logic Error
findings.description: In the SwapBonus contract, the reward distribution was originally designed to release a certain amount of rewards each day to be weighted and divided equally among users. However, the code implementation makes it impossible to satisfy the project design by allowing users to collect rewards for a maximum of 1 day.

findings.title: Pre-Sale Quota Is Susceptible to Manipulation
findings.description: In the _pageWhitePledge_ and _pageOgPledge_ functions of the Presale contract, the purchasable amount is determined by the number of tokens pledged by the user in the pool. The user can pledge and withdraw as many tokens as he wants in the pool to manipulate the purchase amount.

findings.title: Modify Variable Permissions Are Too Large
findings.description: In the Presale contract, Owner has excessive variable modification privileges.

findings.title: Variable Type Error
findings.description: In the Transaction contract, the variable erc20 is defined as type IERC721Metadata, and according to the business logic this variable should represent the ERC20 contract.

findings.title: Redundant Code
findings.description: The code contains redundant lines or expressions that can be removed without affecting the functionality.

findings.title: Anyone Can Mint NFT
findings.description: In normal business logic, users who want to cast NFTs need to pay a certain fee for casting through the _createNft_ function in the Transaction contract. But in the NftToken contract, due to the lack of _pageMint_ function call permission restrictions, anyone can call the _pageMint_ function to cast NFT.

findings.title: Lack of Reward Logic
findings.description: In the SwapBonus contract, the reward distribution was originally designed to release a certain amount of rewards each day to be weighted and divided equally among users. However, the code implementation makes it impossible to satisfy the project design by allowing users to collect rewards for a maximum of 1 day.

findings.title: MiningPool Owner Can Withdraw All Funds
findings.description: The MiningPool owner can withdraw all funds.

findings.title: Funds Locked in Presale Contracts
findings.description: In the _pageWhitePledge_ and _pageOgPledge_ functions of the Presale contract, the purchasable amount is determined by the number of tokens pledged by the user in the pool. The user can pledge and withdraw as many tokens as he wants in the pool to manipulate the purchase amount.
